Package tcpudp_lib

Class ClientHandler

java.lang.Object
tcpudp_lib.ClientHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public class ClientHandler extends Object implements Runnable
This class handles a single client that's connected to the server. Copied from https://github.com/vaqxai/java-tcpclientserver/

    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    private final Socket
    clientSocket
    Socket used to communicate with the client

    Automatic response to this client: if you return "", it will not send a response.

    Writes to the client connection
    private LinkedList<Message>

    Stores received messages in a queue
    private boolean

  • Constructor Details

    • ClientHandler

      public ClientHandler(Socket socket, boolean silent)
      Creates a ClientHandler with the provided server socket, and a response callback.
      Parameters:
      socket - the connected client's socket instance
      silent - should it be silent

  • Method Details

    • setAutoResponse

      public void setAutoResponse(BiFunction<Socket,String,String> newCallback)
      Changes this server's client's automatic response callback
      Parameters:
      newCallback - the new callback, return "" to stop the server from sending an automatic response.

    • getAutoResponse

      public BiFunction<Socket,String,String> getAutoResponse()
      Returns:
      the current callback function

    • getSocket

      public Socket getSocket()
      Returns:
      this client's socket for direct interface

    • send

      public void send(Object message)
      Parameters:
      message - send data directly to this client

    • get

      public String get()
      Returns:
      get latest message the client has sent to us (will hang its thread if there's no incoming messages)

    • run

      public void run()
      Specified by:
      run in interface Runnable
